episodeTitle: And So, The Legend Begins! To the Other Side of the Rainbow!
titleJapanese: そして伝説が始まる！いざ虹の彼方へ
titleRomanized: Soshite densetsu ga hajimaru! Iza niji no kanata e
description: The Straw Hats desperately attempt to escape the collapsing Rainbow Mist dimension as Ape's Concert falls apart. Rapanui Pasqua sacrifices his Marine ship to create the wind needed for the Going Merry to escape. The episode concludes with a shocking time-travel twist as the Pumpkin Pirates are revealed to have become Marines fifty years in the past, arriving to arrest the defeated Wetton.

events.title: Ape's Concert Dimension Begins to Collapse
events.description: The Rainbow Mist dimension known as Ape's Concert starts to destabilize and collapse after Wetton destroyed the Rainbow Tower. The dimension begins tearing itself apart, threatening to trap everyone inside forever.
events.significance: The destruction of the Rainbow Tower triggers the collapse of the time-distorted dimension, forcing an immediate evacuation and setting up the episode's main crisis.

events.title: Rapanui Spots the Sun and Guides the Escape
events.description: As the dimension collapses around them, Rapanui Pasqua spots a beam of sunlight breaking through the chaos. He realizes this is their escape route and directs the Straw Hats to head toward the light while organizing the Pumpkin Pirates' evacuation strategy.
events.significance: Rapanui emerges as the true hero of the arc, demonstrating leadership and quick thinking that saves everyone. This moment establishes him as more capable than Henzo, who had spent 50 years trying to rescue them.

quotes.text: There! The sun! Everyone, head for the light!
quotes.speaker: Rapanui Pasqua
quotes.context: Spotting the escape route as Ape's Concert collapses

events.title: Rapanui Sacrifices His Ship for the Going Merry
events.description: Rapanui Pasqua makes the heroic decision to stay behind and detonate the abandoned Marine warship Tarielishin. The explosion creates a powerful blast of wind that propels the Going Merry toward the exit, ensuring the Straw Hats can escape the collapsing dimension.
events.significance: This selfless sacrifice demonstrates Rapanui's character growth and his commitment to the Pumpkin Pirates' friendship with the Straw Hats. It also shows his willingness to destroy Marine property to save pirates, foreshadowing his complex relationship with Marine duty.

quotes.text: I'll stay behind and blow up the ship. The wind from the explosion will push you out!
quotes.speaker: Rapanui Pasqua
quotes.context: Explaining his sacrifice to save the Straw Hats

events.title: The Going Merry Escapes the Rainbow Mist
events.description: The Going Merry, powered by the explosion from Rapanui's sacrifice, bursts through the dimensional barrier of the Rainbow Mist and returns to the normal world. However, the ship sustains considerable damage during the violent exit, with the hull and sails showing significant wear.
events.significance: The escape marks the resolution of the immediate crisis and the Straw Hats' successful navigation of another dangerous situation. The ship's damage foreshadows the ongoing deterioration of the Going Merry.

quotes.text: We made it! We're out of the Rainbow Mist!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Relief as the Going Merry escapes

events.title: The Rainbow Mist Collapses Completely
events.description: Following the destruction of the Rainbow Tower and the escape of both crews, the Rainbow Mist dimension completely collapses. The time-distorted space tears itself apart, sending the remaining Pumpkin Pirates fifty years into the past and creating a temporal paradox.
events.significance: The collapse of the Rainbow Mist explains the time-travel mechanism that allowed the Pumpkin Pirates to become the Marines who were chasing the Straw Hats. This creates one of the few time-travel storylines in One Piece.

events.title: The Pumpkin Pirates' Time Travel Twist Revealed
events.description: The adult Marines pursuing the Straw Hats are revealed to be the aged versions of the Pumpkin Pirates—Rapanui Pasqua, Isoka, Pukau, Akibi, and Rongo. When the Rainbow Mist collapsed, they were thrown fifty years into the past, where they grew up normally and became Marines. They deliberately kept this secret from Henzo, allowing him to continue his research so the timeline would work correctly.
events.significance: This is the climactic twist of the entire arc, explaining the true nature of the Marines who appeared at the beginning. It creates a stable time loop and reveals that the Pumpkin Pirates orchestrated their own rescue by becoming Marines in the past.

quotes.text: We've been waiting for this day for fifty years, Henzo. We're the Pumpkin Pirates!
quotes.speaker: Rapanui Pasqua
quotes.context: Revealing his true identity to the shocked Henzo

events.title: Henzo Reunites with His Childhood Friends
events.description: Henzo has an emotional reunion with his childhood friends, who are now fifty years older than him and high-ranking Marine officers. After spending fifty years trying to rescue them and living with guilt, Henzo learns they lived full lives as Marines and never blamed him for what happened.
events.significance: This provides emotional closure for Henzo's character arc and resolves his fifty-year guilt. The reunion shows that his friends not only survived but thrived, though they deliberately kept their secret to ensure the timeline remained intact.

quotes.text: I'm still a Pumpkin Pirate and Henzo's friend.
quotes.speaker: Rapanui Pasqua
quotes.context: Reassuring Henzo that their friendship endured across fifty years

events.title: Wetton is Arrested by the Marines
events.description: Mayor Wetton, having been defeated by Luffy and confronted by Sanji and adult Rapanui Pasqua in the previous episode, is formally arrested by the Marine officers (the adult Pumpkin Pirates). He faces charges of piracy, corruption, and the exploitation of Ruluka Island's citizens.
events.significance: Wetton's arrest provides justice for his crimes and liberates Ruluka Island from his tyrannical rule. The fact that he's arrested by the very children he once terrorized adds poetic justice to his downfall.

events.title: The Marines Release the Straw Hats
events.description: Despite being Marine officers duty-bound to arrest pirates, Rapanui Pasqua and his crew deliberately fabricate excuses to let the Straw Hat Pirates go free. They prioritize the friendship and gratitude they feel toward Luffy and his crew over their Marine obligations.
events.significance: This demonstrates the complexity of the Marines and shows that not all Marine officers are strict rule-followers. It also validates the Straw Hats' heroic actions and shows the impact of their kindness.

events.title: A Massive Ship Falls from the Sky
events.description: As the episode concludes, a massive ship suddenly falls from the sky and crashes near the Straw Hats. This bizarre phenomenon shocks the crew and serves as the setup for the next arc, hinting at the existence of Sky Island.
events.significance: This is the first concrete evidence of Sky Island's existence and directly sets up the Jaya Arc and Skypiea Arc. The falling ship demonstrates that islands can exist in the sky, validating the legends that will drive the next major saga.

quotes.text: A ship fell from the sky?!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Shocked reaction to the falling ship

quotes.text: There! The sun! Everyone, head for the light!
quotes.speaker: Rapanui Pasqua
quotes.context: Spotting the escape route from the collapsing dimension

quotes.text: I'll stay behind and blow up the ship. The wind from the explosion will push you out!
quotes.speaker: Rapanui Pasqua
quotes.context: Deciding to sacrifice his ship to save the Straw Hats

quotes.text: We made it! We're out of the Rainbow Mist!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Relief as the Going Merry escapes the dimension

quotes.text: We've been waiting for this day for fifty years, Henzo. We're the Pumpkin Pirates!
quotes.speaker: Rapanui Pasqua
quotes.context: Revealing the time-travel twist to Henzo

quotes.text: I'm still a Pumpkin Pirate and Henzo's friend.
quotes.speaker: Rapanui Pasqua
quotes.context: Reassuring Henzo about their enduring friendship

quotes.text: A ship fell from the sky?!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Shocked reaction to the falling ship that sets up the Jaya Arc

themes.description: The episode explores how true friendship can endure across decades and even temporal paradoxes. The Pumpkin Pirates maintained their bond despite being separated by fifty years and living vastly different lives.
themes.symbolism: The Rainbow Mist serves as a metaphor for the barriers time creates between friends, while the reunion symbolizes the timelessness of true friendship.

themes.description: Rapanui's willingness to sacrifice his ship to save the Straw Hats demonstrates that true heroism means putting others before yourself, even when they are strangers or supposed enemies.
themes.symbolism: The explosion that saves the Going Merry represents how sacrifice can create the wind that carries others forward.

themes.description: The Marines choosing to let the Straw Hats go despite their duty explores the conflict between following rules and doing what's morally right. Personal connections and gratitude override institutional obligations.
themes.symbolism: The adult Pumpkin Pirates as Marines represent the complexity of justice—they serve the law but prioritize personal relationships and moral debts.

themes.description: The stable time loop created by the Pumpkin Pirates' journey suggests that some events are meant to happen. Their deliberate choice not to tell Henzo shows acceptance of destiny and the role they must play.
themes.symbolism: The collapsing Rainbow Mist represents how time inevitably moves forward, even as it loops back on itself.

characterSpotlights.development: Rapanui emerges as the true hero of the arc, demonstrating leadership, quick thinking, and selfless sacrifice. His character arc shows growth from a child pirate to a capable Marine officer who maintains his values.
keyActions: Spots the sun and directs the escape strategy
Sacrifices his ship to save the Going Merry
Reveals his true identity to Henzo
Chooses friendship over Marine duty by releasing the Straw Hats
quotes: There! The sun! Everyone, head for the light!
I'll stay behind and blow up the ship. The wind from the explosion will push you out!
We've been waiting for this day for fifty years, Henzo. We're the Pumpkin Pirates!
I'm still a Pumpkin Pirate and Henzo's friend.

characterSpotlights.development: Henzo's fifty-year journey of guilt and searching comes to an end. He discovers that his friends not only survived but thrived, providing closure for his character arc and releasing him from his burden of guilt.
keyActions: Witnesses the escape from the Rainbow Mist
Learns the truth about his friends becoming Marines

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy and the Straw Hats take a backseat in this episode, allowing the Ruluka Island arc characters to have their emotional resolution. However, their impact on the Pumpkin Pirates is evident in the Marines' decision to let them go.
keyActions: Navigates the Going Merry through the escape
Prepares to depart for the next adventure

mangaDifferences.difference: The entire Ruluka Island Arc is anime-original filler content and does not appear in the manga. Episodes 139-143 have no manga equivalent.

trivia.fact: Episode 143 is the final episode to be dubbed by 4Kids Entertainment, who had been dubbing One Piece since 2004. 4Kids skipped and merged many episodes, so their version ended at episode 104 in their numbering.
The Ruluka Island Arc is one of the few One Piece storylines to feature a stable time loop, where the Pumpkin Pirates become the Marines who pursue the Straw Hats to Ruluka Island in the first place.

sources.title: Ruluka Island Arc - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The massive ship falling from the sky at the end of the episode serves as the direct setup for the Jaya Arc (episodes 144-152), which explores the legend of Sky Island.

The Ruluka Island Arc has been generally considered one of the weaker filler arcs by fans and critics, with criticism focusing on convoluted storytelling, pacing issues, and an underwhelming antagonist.
The opening song 'Hikari e' (Toward the Light) is thematically appropriate for this episode, as Rapanui literally guides everyone toward the light to escape the Rainbow Mist.
